Inferior pulvinar nucleus.TomoDefiningCriteria: located ventrally between the medial and lateral geniculate bodies
Inferior pulvinar nucleus.EditorialNote: A few papers mention this nucleus in the cat.  Needs review
Inferior pulvinar nucleus.Definition: One of four subdivisions recognized in the primate pulvinar based on initially on topography, located ventrally between the medial and lateral geniculate bodies (Carpenter, A core text of neuroanatomy, 3rd ed., 1985, pg 238)
